adrFormatAddress: 326 W 40th St, New York, NY 10018, USA

editorialSummary.text: Unassuming quarters with free WiFi, plus a casual restaurant, a rooftop bar & an exercise room.

originalText.text:
Great hotel!  Everyone is friendly and so helpful.  Doormen are friendly, aware and helpful to your needs. Rooms are clean and good hot water showers.
1 Block from times square with pizza places on each corners, grab and go convenient store, and walgreens within the same block.
Bar tender makes a great strong drink!
I had to leave early and when I called the manager back once I returned home, he knew exactly what I needed and had already taken care of the situation for me and email me the information.
I have worked customer service for years and the people at this hotel know what their doing.
Great price for the area.

originalText.text:
During our stay at Four Points Sheraton over the bustling Christmas period in New York, Ron, Monica, Kevin, and the entire team impressed us with their exceptional customer service. Despite the holiday rush, they worked diligently to secure two rooms close together for us.

What truly stood out was the genuine care demonstrated by Monica and Kevin. While waiting in the lobby, we witnessed their kindness towards an elderly woman without a reservation. Instead of turning her away, they treated her with utmost respect, patiently answering her questions and even offering her water and a piece of fruit during the busy time. This not only showcased their dedication to customer service but also added a heartwarming touch to our experience.

Moreover, the entire team's commitment to creating a positive atmosphere was evident throughout our stay. From the booking process to the thoughtful gestures, we highly recommend the team at Four Points Sheraton for their outstanding service and genuine hospitality.

What truly stood out was the genuine care demonstrated by Monica and Kevin. While waiting in the lobby, we witnessed their kindness towards an elderly woman without a reservation. Instead of turning her away, they treated her with utmost respect, patiently answering her questions and even offering her water and a piece of fruit during the busy time. This not only showcased their dedication to customer service but also added a heartwarming touch to our experience.

Moreover, the entire team's commitment to creating a positive atmosphere was evident throughout our stay. From the booking process to the thoughtful gestures, we highly recommend the team at Four Points Sheraton for their outstanding service and genuine hospitality.

originalText.text: 3.5 / 5 The Four Points has a friendly staff and the rooms were clean. These are always key to a good stay. The rooms are predictably on the smaller side - typical for NYC. Beds were comfortable. AC was very loud when it went on and off. Decor was a bit dated, and my room had was in need of some paint touch ups. Furniture had some damage and there was damage on some of the walls. I had a lower floor, so a view of a side building instead of a good view of mid-town. Your breakfast option is a $22 buffet, which is a great value but I only wanted a bagel and so went down the street. I paid over $320 per night with tax, so part of my rating is based on value.

originalText.text: This place was real surprise. Not only was the room wonderful and comfy, (Especially for NYC) but the staff.. the STAFF. I can't begin to give enough praise to their staff. Every encounter I had with someone behind the desk was lovely. They were friendly and genuinely seemed happy to help. This includes the after hours staff! The breakfast crew, housekeeping, and bar tenders were equally as helpful and friendly. Special shout out to Nicole L. and Monica C. for helping me solve some last minute conflicts that would have put me in a serious pickle if not resolved.

originalText.text:
It's a standard hotel to spend a night. I booked it because it's proximity to the bus terminal. I had an early bus so it was convenient.
Congratulations on the sustainability standards, having dispensers in the shower.
USB plugs weren't working in the room.
